byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Human Rights Watch report offers evidence that Congolese soldiers killed over dozen people, including women and children, while serving as peacekeepers in Central African Republic from December 2013 to June 2015; report adds to mounting evidence of abuse by peacekeepers.
lead_paragraph: A report by Human Rights Watch provided new evidence that Congolese peacekeeping soldiers killed civilians in the Central African Republic.

headline.main: U.N. to Investigate Peacekeepers Suspected of Killing Women and Children in Africa
headline.print_headline: Peacekeepers  Killed Women  in Africa,  Report Says

snippet: A report by Human Rights Watch provided new evidence that Congolese peacekeeping soldiers killed civilians in the Central African Republic.

keywords.value: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations
keywords.name: organizations
